snippet: Li Ying, who was charged with manslaughter and endangering the welfare of a child, had been accused of failing to promptly call 911 when her 2-month-old daughter became unconscious.
abstract: Charges are dropped against Li Ying of Queens, who spent nearly four years in jail for manslaughter after allegedly failing to promptly call 911 when infant daughter became unconscious; prosecutors drop charge based on statements by medical officials that child's injuries were so severe immediate medical response would not have saved her life; Li's companion LI Hangbin faces charges of second-degree murder in case.

byline.original: By COREY KILGANNON and JEFFREY E. SINGER

lead_paragraph: Li Ying, who was charged with manslaughter and endangering the welfare of a child, had been accused of failing to promptly call 911 when her 2-month-old daughter became unconscious.

headline.seo: Charges Dropped Against Mother in Shaken-Baby Case
headline.main: Charges Are Dropped Against Mother in Shaken-Baby Case
headline.print_headline: Charges Are Dropped Against Mother in Shaken-Baby Case
